fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • In a report about Jonathan Ross's final chat show on BBC1, we quoted his guest Jackie Chan as saying: "I don't want to be an actor who can fight. I want to be a fighter who can act." In fact, he said the opposite: "I want to be an actor who can fight. I don't want to be a fighter who can act." (Final night: Emotional Ross stops talking after a decade of chat, 17 July, page 5, later editions.) • We misspelled the name of the dancer Louie Spence, a guest on the debut edition of Radio 5 Live's Men's Hour, as Louis Spence in an article, First night: More than just a male imitation, 19 July, page 5. • Mitch McConnell is the minority, not majority, leader in the US Senate (Welcome boost for Obama as Senate backs Wall St reform, 16 July, page 18). • An article about the serial killer Peter Tobin (Police search for evidence of more Tobin murder victims, 13 July, page 9) said he had moved around the country using alibis. Aliases is the word we should have used. Alibi: a defence by an accused person that he was elsewhere at the time the crime in question was committed; alias: an assumed name (Collins dictionary).
